H0.text: Which Booker Prize winning novelist wrote the Advertising slogan 'That will do nicely' for American Express. Ian McEwan

H1.text: Which Booker Prize winning novelist wrote the Advertising slogan 'That will do nicely' for American Express. Margaret Atwood

H2.text: Which Booker Prize winning novelist wrote the Advertising slogan 'That will do nicely' for American Express. Kazuo Ishiguro

H3.text: Which Booker Prize winning novelist wrote the Advertising slogan 'That will do nicely' for American Express. Rushdian

A4.text: Kazuo Ishiguro won the Booker Prize for The Remains of the Day in 1989

A5.text: Kazuo Ishiguro was shortlisted for the Booker Prize four times, winning in 1989 for The Remains of the Day
